intro: Myriophyllum verticillatum var. intermedium, commonly known as narrow-leaf watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to North America. It has slender, branching stems that are often found in shallow, slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spiral-like arrangements. Its leaves are narrow and whorled, often giving it a feathery appearance. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
